subject: RE: [junit] Best practices for testing approximate equivalence?
msgSnippet: I think assertEquals(floating point number, floating point number, margin of error) may be what you re looking for. Peter Spitz Team Leader/Senior Software
messageBody:
I think assertEquals(floating point number, floating point number, margin of
error) may be what you're looking for.

> From: David V. Olivier [mailto:dolivier@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 08, 2002 9:49 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Best practices for testing approximate equivalence?
>
>
> Does anybody have a good working approach to testing
> "equality" of real
> numbers. For example, my expected result is precisely:
>
> 30
>
> In actuality I get:
>
> 30.000000445292045
>
> This is "close enough". Of course I can test:
>
> 30 - marginOfError < result < 30 + marginOfError
>
> but this clutters the code. Any suggestions?
>
